e6271a40-dca1-530e-9e7d-93ae504aaf0c.title: Acceptance Criteria - Prior to the import of Type A material, FH to provide the Superintendent, at least 1 week prior to the commencement of cartage, copies of test results to confirm that the proposed Type A material complies with section 204 of the VicRoads Spec.

d48bd243-75f0-50a4-8d6e-413df7fc483b.title: Type A Material shall meet the following requirements:

e15a9169-8af2-5caa-976b-717e1fca1c65.title: Record of conformity - ITP visually reviewed by Engineer

17e7e24b-7381-55b1-92d3-243fecfe7943.title: Acceptance Criteria - No fill is to be placed on the prepared areas until the the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.

b4c24f1b-6299-5795-8689-c576abe44f3a.title: Record of conformity - Survey records & pegs on the ground

32604506-a4c7-5037-952c-d0e77b25e1eb.title: Reference Documents - Project General Specification Cl.1190.06 Latest IFC Drawings

28fd853d-b297-5560-aa9b-8cbf8268e5be.title: Acceptance Criteria - Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used. The boxing width shall not be less than specified or shown on the drawings and the edges of boxing shall not deviate by more than 50 mm from the designed offset from the centreline or design line.

8570b0ce-897d-5e74-b27f-d7205411e9a6.title: Frequency - Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used.

1c4c78c9-4d98-5870-b480-149c132423d0.title: Any rocky material present must be uniform throughout the layer.

ddb78c05-cbd6-58c9-8c58-ab5b47438584.title: Each layer shall be keyed in to the layer above by means of a textured surface

7220a2ef-8779-58f3-9902-cdd83028f59d.title: Acceptance Criteria - Fill material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm compacted thickness. Layers with a compacted thickness >200mm may be placed subject to approval from the Superintendent.

60ed2202-0d66-5d5d-b978-6f2ced0d5021.title: Surface is smooth, hard, tightly bound and free from depressions which are capable of holding water Surface is not to be more than 15mm or less than 30mm from what is specificed in IFC drawings

36a66939-323c-5b98-88d0-a988ae468bf4.title: Frequency - Prior to placement of next layer

7276807a-06a4-557d-82b6-4f41bc3ffac4.title: Acceptance Criteria - The level tolerances at any point on the subgrade shall not lie more than 20 mm below a 3 m straightedge laid in any direction, except across a crown and water shall not pond at any point.

ae97efb5-fb27-5df6-b88a-4e39fc819a4a.title: Fulton Hogan to provide not less than 24hrs notice to the Superintendent of the location and commencement time for test rolling.

9851c363-f837-5760-b3bc-01a143f003c2.title: Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall propose in situ treatment and depth of excavation to the Superintendent for review.

629a0dac-7478-5202-bbee-1084ecf0d2d8.title: Frequency - Proof Roll - Top of placed layer

41411319-d3d0-58a1-8845-8570d7a8f95a.title: Acceptance Criteria - Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.

a1d4049f-5af5-5c61-a049-5ee31262b9f7.title: Where <10% of the lot area is deemed unsuitable, material shall be rectified as agreed by the Contractor and Superintendent

2d063e62-da54-5f23-b3a7-e4f29ef2621d.title: No fill is to be placed on the prepared areas until the the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
